page.title: 10Local History in Inverbervie
page.content: We visited an old age pensioner who has lived in Inverbervie for forty five years. He lives in Market Square opposite the{Market Cross.}The last time the{town crier}made a proclamation there was for the Queen's Coronation in 1952. Before retiring he used to drive a flax lorry for one of the{nine flax} {mills,}only one of which is in use today. He also used to be a magistrate who dealt out punishment to petty criminals. As a boy he played football, hoops and golf on a small six hole golf course in front of Peattie Farm. He also told us that the site on which the school is now once belonged to the Church of Scotland and the minister grazed his horses on what is now our playing field.
